snippet: The pilots union approved a new contract, freeing American Airlines to come out of bankruptcy, and possibly pursue a merger with US Airways.
abstract: American Airlines is now free to decide whether they should pursue a merger with US Airways or remain independent after pilots union approved a new contract that will allow the carrier to come out of bankruptcy. US Airways put forward a merger proposal, which values the combined entity at around $8 billion, giving American’s creditors 70 percent of the new airline and US Airways’ shareholders 30 percent.
lead_paragraph: The pilots union approved a new contract, freeing American Airlines to come out of bankruptcy, and possibly pursue a merger with US Airways.

headline.seo: American Airlines Pilots Agree to New Contract
headline.main: American Airlines All Clear for Bankruptcy Exit
